avatar.name: avatar
avatar.description: **displays the avatar of a Discord user**
avatar.options:
• **ID**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the user ID of a Discord user (example: `527828928803373065`)
		• **Mention**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>a Discord user in the form of a mention (example: <@527828928803373065>)
		• **Tag**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the tag of a Discord user, which is composed of their name and discriminator
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz#6270`

badges.name: badges
badges.description: **displays the badges of a Discord user**
badges.options:
• **ID**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the user ID of a Discord user (example: `527828928803373065`)
		• **Mention**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>a Discord user in the form of a mention (example: <@527828928803373065>)
		• **Tag**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the tag of a Discord user, which is composed of their name and discriminator
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz#6270`

giveaway.name: giveaway
giveaway.description: **commands for the usage and management of giveaways**

help.name: help
help.description: **shows help information about bot commands and command categories**

message.name: message
message.description: **sends a private message to a user**
message.options:
• **ID of recepient**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the user ID of a Discord user
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `527828928803373065`
		• **message**
		the message to be sent to the specified user

poll.name: poll
poll.description: **makes a poll wherein users can vote through message reactions**

profile.name: profile
profile.description: **shows the profile of a Discord user**
profile.options:
• **ID**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the user ID of a Discord user (example: `527828928803373065`)
		• **Mention**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>a Discord user in the form of a mention (example: <@527828928803373065>)
		• **Tag**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the tag of a Discord user, which is composed of their name and discriminator
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz#6270`

purge.name: purge
purge.description: **deletes a specified number of messages from a channel**
purge.options:
• **number**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the number of messages to be removed from the channel
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this number shall not be lower than `2` and not higher than `99`

settings.name: settings
settings.description: **shows the bot's settings for the current server**

choose.name: choose
choose.description: **chooses one from a specified pool of objects**
choose.options:
• **choices**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the options to choose from
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the options must be separated from each other by commas (`,`)

hangman.name: hangman
hangman.description:
**play a game of hangman**

		__**How to Play**__
		The main goal is to find the hidden word, phrase, or sentence.
		The game ends once the hidden word/phrase/sentence has been guessed.
		Players will earn points depending on the number of letters that they were able to reveal.

		__**Gamemodes**__
		:man: **Solo**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>One player. The bot thinks of a hidden word. The player will guess the word.
		:crossed_swords: **Duo** `Version 2.1+`
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>Two players. Players must come up with a hidden word that must be guessed by the other player.
hangman.options:
• **"start"**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>start a game of hangman
		• **"stop"**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>stops the game of hangman that you have started

howbanal.description:

		<:Reply:986293903131050045>you can also leave this blank to measure yourself

		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz#6270`

		<:Reply:986293903131050045>you can also leave this blank to measure yourself

• **ID**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the user ID of a Discord user (example: `527828928803373065`)

		<:Reply:986293903131050045>a Discord user in the form of a mention (example: <@527828928803373065>)

renz.name: renz
renz.options:
• **add <name> | <[message] | [image]>**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>adds a tag in the current server
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz add examplename | *my custom message* | https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/852816062689181716/984170362617073745/sheesh.gif`
		**-** *name* - the name of the tag to be added
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this is used when calling/using the tag
		**-** *message* - the message that will be shown whenever the tag is used
		**-** *image* - a link to an image that will be shown whenever the tag is used
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>you can also attach the image to be used to your message

		• **information <name>**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>displays information about a tag
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz information mytag`
		**-** *name* - the name of the tag to be queried

		• **list**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>displays the names of all the tags in the current server

		• **remove <name>**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>removes a tag from the current server
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>only the user who added the tag, as well as server members with `Permission.MANAGE_SERVER` can remove a tag
		**-** *pangalan* - the name of the tag to be removed

		• **tag**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the name of the tag to be used
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz mytag`

rockpaperscissors.name: rockpaperscissors
rockpaperscissors.description:
**play a game of rock-paper-scissors**
	<:Reply:986293903131050045>if no user was mentioned, the bot will serve as the opponent
rockpaperscissors.options:
• **ID**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the user ID of a Discord user (example: `527828928803373065`)
		• **Mention**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>a Discord user in the form of a mention (example: <@527828928803373065>)
		• **Tag**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the tag of a Discord user, which is composed of their name and discriminator
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz#6270`

titobadang.name: titobadang
titobadang.description:
***DALAWANG BESES NA YAN*
shows a transcript of Tito Badang's infamous video**

trivia.name: trivia
trivia.description:
**gives a trivia that you can answer**
	<:Reply:986293903131050045>there are three trivia levels: `Easy`, `Average`, and `Difficult`

myanimelist.name: myanimelist
myanimelist.description: **searches MyAnimeList for an anime or manga**
myanimelist.options:
• **anime|manga**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>specifies the type of query to be performed (whether `anime` or `manga`)
		• **search**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>can be used to display multiple results from a search query
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this also lets you choose one entry to be displayed
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>if this is not used, the command will automatically return the first result of the search query
		• **name**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the name of the anime or manga to be searched

nhentai.name: nhentai
nhentai.description: **searches NHentai for a gallery or comic**
nhentai.options:
• **ID**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the ID of an NHentai gallery (example: `272727`)
		• **"RANDOM"**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>searches for a *random* NHentai gallery
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this command uses the link [`nhentai.net/random`](https://www.nhentai.net/random)

qr.name: qr
qr.description: **commands for creating and scanning QR codes**
qr.options:
• **qr generate <content>**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>generates a QR code
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `qr likha kamusta!`
		**-** *content* - the content of the QR code
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this is what is being displayed whenever the QR code is scanned

		• **qr scan <image>**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>scans the provided QR code
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `qr scan https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/930613462994911232/1005877717759172648/unknown.png?width=468&height=468`
		**-** *imahe* - a link to an image containing the QR code to be scanned
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>you may also include the image as an attachment to the message
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>you may also reply to a message with an image to scan the image on the referenced message

saucenao.name: saucenao
saucenao.description: **attempts to find the source of a given image**
saucenao.options:
• **image**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the link of the image to be queried
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/527828928803373065/4922081075ab7e2673f3b044b9e993c5.png?size=1024`
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the image may also be attached to your message

translate.name: translate
translate.description: **translates a given message from one language to another**
translate.options:
• **from**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the language of the original message
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `TL` for Tagalog
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>you can also put `AUTO` and let the bot detect the language of your message
		• **to**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the language to which the original message will be translated to
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `JA` for the Japanese language
		• **message**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the message to be translated to another language
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the message shall not be longer than 500 characters

wikipedia.name: wikipedia
wikipedia.description: searches Wikipedia for an article and displays the first result
wikipedia.options:
• **name**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the name of the article to be searched for in Wikipedia

back.name: back
back.description: **plays previous song or adds it to the back of queue (if the queue is not empty)**

lyrics.name: lyrics
lyrics.description:
**shows the lyrics of a song**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>you may also leave this blank to return the lyrics of the currently-playing song
lyrics.options:
• **name**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the name of the song whose lyrics is to be searched for

nowplaying.name: nowplaying
nowplaying.description: shows the music that is currently playing

play.name: play
play.options:
• **"playlist"**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>you can include the keyword "playlist" to specify that you want to play a Renz-Bot playlist
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>refer to the command `playlists` for the list of available Renz-Bot playlists
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this shall not be used if the playlist to be loaded comes from *YouTube* or other external sources
		• **name**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the name of the track or playlist to be played
		• **URL**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the URL or link to a track or playlist to be played

playlist.name: playlist
playlist.description: **commands for the management and usage of playlists**
playlist.options:
• **add <name> | [scope] | <track> | <track> | ...**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>adds track(s) to the specified playlist
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `playlist add myplaylist | https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WWB01IuMvzA`
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this adds a track with the URL `https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WWB01IuMvzA` to the playlist `myplaylist`
		**-** *name* - the name of the playlist to be appended
		**-** *scope* - the scope or privacy level of the playlist to be appended
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this may be `server` or `private`
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the bot will try to find a playlist with either scope if the scope was not specified
		**-** *track* - the track(s) to be added to the specified playlist
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this can be in the form of a URL or link to a track
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the keyword `ytsearch: <name>` may also be used to search for a track with the specified name (example: `ytsearch: God Knows`)

		• **create <name> | [scope]**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>creates a new playlist
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `playlist create myplaylist | server`
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this creates a server playlist with the name `myplaylist`
		**-** *name* - the name of the playlist to be created
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this is used in playing the playlist
		**-** *scope* - the scope or privacy level of the playlist to be created
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this may be `server` o `private`
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>defaults to `private` if not specified

		• **list**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>lists all the available playlists

		• **remove <name> | [scope]**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>removes the specified playlist
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>by default, you may only remove your own playlists (private) and server playlists that you have created
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>server admins or members with `Permission.MANAGE_SERVER` may remove any server playlist at will
		**-** *name* - the name of the playlist to be removed
		**-** *scope* - the scope or privacy level of the playlist to be removed
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this may be `server` or `private`

queue.name: queue
queue.options:
• **page**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the queue page (a maximum of 10 tracks can be shown for each page)

remove.name: remove
remove.options:
• **ALL**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>removes all the tracks that you have enqueued
		• **position**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the position of the track to be removed from the queue

search.name: search
search.options:
• **query**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the name of the track to be searched on *YouTube*

scsearch.name: scsearch
scsearch.description: **searches *SoundCloud* for a provided query and plays the first result**
scsearch.options:
• **query**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the name of the track to be searched on *SoundCloud*

seek.name: seek
seek.description: **jumps to the specified part or section of the current track**
seek.options:
• **+|-**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>used to specify to seek forward or backward, relative to the current position/timestamp of the currently-playing track
		• **HH:MM:SS**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the exact timestamp to seek to
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>`HH` - Hours, `MM` - Minutes, `SS` - Seconds

shuffle.name: shuffle
shuffle.description: **shuffles the order of the tracks in the queue**
shuffle.options:
• **ALL**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>shuffles the order of all the tracks in the queue
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>only server DJs can use this command
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>if this is not used, only the tracks that you have added to the queue will be shuffled

forceremove.name: forceremove
forceremove.description: **removes all entries of the specified user from the queue**

movetrack.name: movetrack
movetrack.description: **moves a track in the queue to another position**

playnext.name: playnext
playnext.description: **adds a song to the front of the queue**

repeat.name: repeat
repeat.description: re-adds music to the queue when finished

setfilter.name: setfilter
setfilter.description: allows or denies the usage of audio filters in the current server

skipto.name: skipto
skipto.description: **skips to the track at the specified queue position**

stop.name: stop
stop.description: **stops the current track, clears the queue, and leaves the voice channel**

kick.name: kick
kick.description: **kicks a member from the current server**
kick.options:
• **ID**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the user ID of the Discord user to be kicked from the current server (example: `527828928803373065`)
		• **Mention**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the Discord user to be kicked from the current server, in the form of a mention (example: <@527828928803373065>)
		• **Tag**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the tag of a Discord user to be kicked from the current server
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this is composed of their name and discriminator
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>example: `renz#6270`
		• **reason**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the reason for kicking the specified user from the current server

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.description: **sets a server-specific prefix for the usage of bot commands**

setcompactmode.name: setcompactmode
setcompactmode.description: **shortens (or returns to normal) the messages sent when queuing tracks**

setdj.name: setdj
setdj.description:
**sets the DJ role, which will be given permission to use certain music commands**
	<:Reply:986293903131050045>if this is not set, all server members are considered as DJs, and will be given equal access to all music commands

setgiveaway.name: setgiveaway
setgiveaway.description: **sets a server-specific role that will be notified whenever there is a new giveaway**

setlanguage.name: setlanguage
setlanguage.description: **sets the server-specific language to be used by the bot in its messages**

setskip.name: setskip
setskip.description: **sets the server-specific percentage of listeners that must agree before skipping a track**

setrestrictedtc.name: setrestrictedtc
setrestrictedtc.description: **sets a server-specific text channel wherein the usage of certain fun commands are forbidden**

settc.name: settc
settc.description: **sets the text channel for music-related commands**

setvc.name: setvc
setvc.description: **sets the voice channel for playing music**

warn.name: warning
warn.description:
**warns the specified server member**
	<:Reply:986293903131050045>you can use the command `warning list [ID|Mention|Tag]` to display the warnings of a server member
	<:Reply:986293903131050045>you may also leave the command blank to view your own warnings
warn.options:
• **ID**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the user ID of the Discord user to be warned (example: `527828928803373065`)
		• **Mention**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the Discord user to be warned in the form of a mention (example: <@527828928803373065>)
		• **Tag**
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>the tag of a Discord user to be warned
		<:Reply:986293903131050045>this is composed of their name and discriminator
